column2:
I saw this really sculpted,
scrumptious-looking man the
other day. Real debonair,
too, with his black cape!
column3: 我看到一个很帅的男人哦！\n黑色的斗蓬把他衬托得\n更加英俊迷人...

column2:
But when he looked at me,
I swear I was scared out of
my mind. His eyes...were
almost inhuman...
column3: 可当他看着我时，\n那眼神...不像人类...锐利得吓人，\n我不敢找他讲话...。

column2:
Hmmm... You're not too bad
yourself, actually. But you
might be a little young...
for what I have in mind.
column3: 嗯~~\n你的长相也不错啦，可是，\n年纪比我小耶...
可怜的邻居...。

column2:
That guy in the black cape
was quite a specimen...
but you're really not too
bad yourself, either!
column3: 之前看到的穿黑色斗蓬的男人\n确实英俊，但是，\n你也是不亚于他的美男子哦。

column2:
Age to perfection, young man.
Age, and come back to me.
I'll be waiting for you
with bated breath!
column3: 美中不足的是...你比我年轻...

column2:
My, my, you certainly have...
ripened...since I saw you last.
Just look at how those muscles
have grown!
column3: 啊，才多久没见，\n你好像变得有男子气概了。

column2: ...I'm terrible, aren't I?\nI should leave such lechery\nto the men!
column3: ...我是不是有点过头了？\n再把你当成男孩可能太失礼了。

column2:
At any rate, I don't know who
it is you're trying so hard
for...but she's a very lucky
woman. A lucky woman, indeed!
column3: 我不知道你是为了谁这么努力啦，不过，\n她是个非常幸运的女人。\n真是个幸运的女人！

column2: Hey, Adol! You remember me?\nWe met in the portside\nwarehouse in Barbado!
column3: 嗨，这不是亚特鲁吗！\n你还记得我吗，我们在巴尔巴多的仓库碰过面对吧？

column2:
What am I doing here?
Well, I'm not sightseeing!
I came on militia-related
business, actually.
column3: 我可不是来玩的哦。\n我是为了自卫队的事而来的。

column2: Speaking of which, Slaff's\nbeen asking about you.
column3: 对了，斯拉夫\n一直很担心你的事哦。

column2: It'd be nice if you checked\nback with him sometime.
column3: 你就偶尔去找他一下吧。\n他会很开心的。

column2: Hey, Adol! You remember me?\nWe met in the portside\nwarehouse in Barbado!
column3: 嗨，这不是亚特鲁吗！\n你还记得我吗，我们在巴尔巴多的仓库碰过面对吧？

column2:
What am I doing here?
Well, I'm not sightseeing!
I came on militia-related
business, actually.
column3: 我可不是来玩的哦。\n我是为了自卫队的事而来的。

column2: It seems like something\nbig is happening...
column3: 听说这里也发生了\n重大状况...。

column2: I think these city walls\nare making us soft!
column3: 在城墙的保护下依然还是出事了。\n这下子我们得更加的提高警觉才行。
咕噜咕噜咕噜...
呼，凉冰冰的沁到五脏六腑去啦。

column2: Hey, bro... You want\na drink, too?
column3: 唷，小兄弟。\n你要不要也来喝一杯呀？

column2:
A minor? Only 17?! Man,
you're just a kid! I don't
even remember what I was
doing when I was your age...
column3: 未成年？17岁吗...这么年轻啊。\n我以前17岁的时候都在干什么？\n人呀，年老的速度真是快呀。
你有去占卜店看了吗？

column2:
She may be young, but she's good.
If you're ever in need of advice
or guidance, she can always set
you on the right path.
column3:
那里的女老板虽然年轻，
不过占卜能力很强哦。
不知道自己该何去何从的时候，
可以去找她商量，挺不错的。

column2: You're that warrior Sara\nspoke of, are you not?
column3: 原来莎拉所说的旅行的剑士大人\n就是你啊。

column2:
She's always trying to protect
this land from any further
catastrophe. Hope you're up
to the task, chosen one!
column3: 莎拉她似乎想要阻止\n这个国家正在发生的灾难。\n拜托你，请不要让她的期待落空。
我的工作是艾斯塔里亚的旅游导游。

column2:
Or at least, I used to be.
That blasted Stormwall and
all the monsters have driven
me right out of business!
column3: 因为岚之结界跟魔物的关系，目前正在失业中。

column2:
There was once an odd old
man who wanted to tour the
mountain ruins-- this was
before the Stormwall.
column3: ...对了，岚之结界发生之前，\n我曾经带一位奇怪的老人到山上的遗迹。

column2: He seemed to be a scholar, and\nsaid he planned on investigating\nDarm Tower. I hope he's okay!
column3: 他看起来像是学者的样子。\n当时他还说要去达姆之塔。\n但愿他平安无事...。

column2:
That poor old man and I
parted ways at the old
shrine. Wonder if he's
even still alive...
column3: 后来我们走散了，不知道那个老爷爷要不要紧？

column2:
Yessir, I showed people all
the sights, from Darm Tower
to Whitehorn Beach, the old
shrine, and Bagyu Ba'dead...
column3: 达姆之塔跟白号角砂滩。\n古代的神殿、巴丘·巴迪多。

column2:
Playing tour guide takes
a lot out of you. Gotta
eat really well to stay
in shape for the job!
column3: 以前我还以为在这座岛上当导游，\n绝对不可能失业，结果，\n重要的游客不来我也没办法...
欢迎光临。\n啊，以前从没看过你哦？

column2:
Don't worry, traveler. The city
of Minea is a safe haven from
the monsters. You have nothing
to worry about here!
column3: 待在城里不会有安全问题，旅行者，\n请在这里好好散心享乐吧。

column2: That poor fortuneteller.\nTo have died so young...
column3: 占卜师姐姐好可怜啊。\n她还那么年轻的说...

column2:
All the regulars here get
gloomier by the day. Though
granted, there isn't much
to be cheerful about lately...
column3: 来这里的客人，随着时间的经过，\n脸色一天比一天难看。\n不知道有没有什么让人开心的话题呢。

column2: Where did I get hurt, you\nask? In my own home, that's\nwhere! I was attacked!
column3: 你问我是在哪里受伤的？\n我只是待在家里就被莫名奇妙的攻击啦！

column2:
He hit me from behind, so
I didn't see his face...but
I'll bet anything it was one
of those damned thieves.
column3: 我是被人从背后殴打的，\n当然也就没看到脸了...\n不过我很笃定，一定是传说中的盗贼没错！

column2: And he stole the silver shield\nthat's been in my family for\ncountless generations...
column3: 竟然把代代相传的东西\n银色之盾给盗走...。

column2:
I had it tucked away in a
corner of my old storeroom.
Probably wasn't worth much,
but even so, it's the idea!
column3: 不过那东西过去一直被扔在\n仓库的一角没人整理，\n照理来说应该不是值钱的东西...

column2: First demons, then thieves...\nThere's no peace around here\nanymore!
column3: 先是魔物，现在又来盗贼...\n世界变得越来越危险了。

column2: That shield... It's the\none that was stolen from\nmy house!
column3: 那个正是我们家失窃的盾牌...。

column2: What's that? It was down in\nthe depths of the old shrine?\nHow the hell'd it get there?!
column3: ...你说什么，\n被藏在神殿的地下？\n怎么会有这么离奇的事呀...

column2: Well, you seem like you're\ngetting good use out of it.\nKeep it, man. I don't need it.
column3: 唷，年轻人，你若不嫌弃，\n就继续使用那个盾牌？

column2:
Actually, it almost feels like
the reason I've been holding on
to it all this time was so I
could give it to you...
column3: 不知为什么，我总有种感觉，\n那东西是为了交到你的手中，\n才在我家流传下来...

column2:
Better it be used to its full
potential than collect dust
in an old storage closet,
after all!
column3: 与其让盾牌摆在我家仓库蒙尘，\n还不如留在你的手中来得恰当。

column2: Indeed... I'd even say it\nsuits you. Brings out the\ncolor in your eyes!
column3: 确实如此...\n我甚至会说它很适合你。\n显得你眼眸中的颜色更加鲜艳。

column2:
The wild dogs out in the field
are called Rhebolls. They're
extremely fast, so take heed
around them.
column3: 草原的野狗『利伯鲁』\n跑的速度很快，对它要小心一点。

column2: I got surrounded by a whole\nherd of them-- which is how\nI came to be in this state!
column3: 我就是被它们包围，变成了这副样子。

column2:
I managed to slip away and run
to the big tree in the field.
For some reason, the Rhebolls
turned back at that point.
column3: 不过...当我逃到\n草原上的大树附近时，\n那些利伯鲁就停下来不追了。

column2:
As a result, I'm still alive,
and not TOO much worse for the
wear. But I do wonder what it
was that drove them away...
column3: 要不是这样，恐怕就不只是受伤而已了。\n我实在搞不明白，那到底是怎么回事...？

column2:
Either way, I owe my life
to that tree. Or something
in the air around it. Or
perhaps just divine mercy!
column3:
唉，不管怎样，
我能活着都是多亏了那棵树...
或者是它周围空气中的什么东西...
也或者是神灵的怜悯！
嗯嗯嗯嗯...呼噜噜...
嘿嘿嘿，伤脑筋...
救命呀...野狗，利伯鲁来啦...
呼噜噜...

column2: Adol introduced himself and explained\nhis reason for coming to the shrine.
column3: \n亚特鲁报出自己的姓名，\n并说明来到神殿的目的。
